title: Shaving Bowl, 1760s
provenance: Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw; 2006: acquired by Museum
creditline: Gift of Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw
description: Slightly everted cylindrical form with pinched indentation at rim, two mask handles; white ground with blue, green, and ochre armorial decoration of shield surmounted by crown and flanked by two dalmations, and above star-shaped medallion; swags and foliate forms below rim and above base.

tombstone.epitaph: Shaving Bowl, 1760s. Tin-glazed earthenware. Gift of Eugene V. and Clare E. Thaw. 2006-27-11.
